I support the Soroptimist International of San Francisco, Founded in 1921, Soroptimist comprises almost 100,000 members in about 120 countries and territories worldwide who contribute time and financial support to community-based projects benefiting women. Soroptimist's major service project, the Women's Opportunity Awards program, provides cash grants for women seeking to improve their economic situation through additional education and training. Soroptimist International is a non-governmental organization with Category 1 status at the United Nations. For more information about how Soroptimist makes a difference for women, you can also go to www.soroptimist.org

lenders.name: Joseph
lenders.loan_because: People-to-people loans are the most direct means to help individuals move from poverty to being relatively poor. I served as a Peace Corps Volunteer and have personal witness to the power of access to such micro-capital to helping people achieve individual success. As of 2007, $55 billion dollars a year is moving between family members in the US to Latin America in the form of direct aid versus the paultry $1.6 billion in government-to-government aid which is being stolen through ingraind corruption. KIVA is the best concept I have found (other than personal relationships) to match a genuine need with those wishing to help.

lenders.name: Min-Ah & Stephen
lenders.loan_because: There is the expression give a man a fish and he is fed for a day, but teach him to fish and he is fed for a lifetime. With micro-lenders the story goes something like the following. The man knows how to fish but he doesn't have the money to buy fishing gear. The bank won't lend him the money because they can't be bothered doing business on such a small scale. Luckily there is another kind of financial institution that can connect him with ordinary folk who happen to be blessed with more money than they need and the realization that they are lucky to be in that situation. So the fellow gets his gear. Groups like Kiva are the other kind of financial organization. You and I are the lucky and you know it. If you aren't already doing your part what are you waiting for?
